intro: Acrospira breviscapa, commonly known as the short-capped acrospira, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and short, broad leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and a preference for well-drained soil. Acrospira breviscapa is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
